content.question: If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>G</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3985@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is an antiderivative for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39A4@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>G</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>G</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A4C@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals
